fields.description:
When I embed an Excel spreadsheet in a Confluence page with the {viewxls} macro, all the text in the cells that are hyperlinked actually appear as their respective hyperlink addresses (i.e. URLs). For example, if a cell contains the text "Confluence" and it hyperlinks to "http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/", then the link "http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/" will appear in the cell in the embedded Excel spreadsheet. 
However, when you open the spreadsheet in Excel (via Edit Document or otherwise), the hyperlinked cells' text appears as expected.
fields.summary: viewxls converts text to hyperlink addresses

fields.description:
This appears to be a regression of CONF-20441 affecting only IE7 on the Easy Reader Theme.
{panel}
*Steps to Repro:*
# Create a new space and choose the Easy Reader Theme.
# Using IE7 create a new page within the space with a good amount of dummy content.
# Click the Preview tab to view a preview of your page.

*Expected:*
The preview of the page will expand to show all of the content contained on the page.

*Actual:*
The preview fails to show all of the content, instead cutting off the page.
{panel}
fields.summary: Editor Preview doesn't expand to show complete content in Easy Reader Theme on IE7

fields.description:
The user noticed a difference in the Rich Text Editor in Confluence 3.0.1 and 3.4.9. In 3.0.1 it appears wiki markup that is contained within a user macro is 'rendered' and formatting applied and in 3.4.9 wiki markup does not render. Please review screen shots. 

Notice "This is a test in indent" is rendered h1. markup.

In 3.4.9, notice the markup within the user macro does not have formatting applied. You just see wiki markup. In this is case h1. This is a test in indent. Is there a way to set the Rich Text Editor to render wiki markup if it is within user macros? ( like 3.0.1 )?

We switched macro to escape html which allowed macro to render in rich text editor. However, since we were escaping html, when   coding was used, it would no render ( as expected ) .

When we save the page, everything is fine. We only have the issue in the rich text editor.
fields.summary: User Macros that contain markup do not render markup in Rich Text Editor
Code macro's syntax highlighter fails- java syntax highlighter trailing comments highlight overflow

fields.description: When you click a link to a network file share in ie, the links no longer work. This seems to be due to Windows Update (2556532) in IE. The information can be found in this Microsoft bulletin: http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms11-068.mspx.
fields.summary: Links to file shares no longer work in ie, due to windows security update 2556532

Please make Confluence's like JIRA's.

fields.description:
My customer was attempting to edit a teammate's Comment on their space, as his Attachment (an .xlsx file) did not show up as clickable.  The customer added the attachment again just below (and within) his teammate's original comment, saved it and received an error of sorts (see attachment).  He tried adding a brand new comment, this time with a .png file from their Attachments list for the Space, and the same thing happened.  They ended up with a line that noted the file name, a replacement name before it, and the line was highlighted red.

The customer tried this same method on a Test Space we have on Confluence, and received no error.  I also tried this on their Space, as well as the Test Space and encountered the same results.
fields.summary: Inserting Attachment in Comment results in red highlighted unclickable link
Include space key in the Default Space Content -> Space Homes Pages template

fields.summary: Pagetree Search Macro: Search box is not internationalised

fields.description:
Adding pages to a space where the new page has a lot of sibling pages performs poorly. The performance degrades linearly as more siblings are added. From my testing an empty space took 10ms to add a page, but a space with 10,000 root level pages took 1 second to add a single page via SOAP or XML-RPC. It also has the potential to cause an OutOfMemoryError.

This occurs because of the fix for CONF-14681, which loads all the sibling pages to determine if they are ordered and if they are, what the new page's position should be. This is easily replaced by code that looks up the highest position value for that level of the page tree.
fields.summary: Adding pages with a lot of sibling pages performs poorly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23114].
  {panel}

Some user names do not show up in autocomplete within the Share dialog and the restrictions dialog.

h3.Workarround:
go to the user account directly by editing the url:
- {{https://<BASE URL>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~<INSERT USERNAME HERE>}}

Then it has been found that a content re-index is necessary to complete
To launch Content re-index see:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration

Cloud users needing content re-index will need to file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com see:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33400
fields.summary: Some people not showing up in user autocomplete for Share button

fields.description: Minor changes are a bit of an ongoing bugbear.  User won't reliably check the Minor Change box.  Could the editor actually detect the amount of change on a page and use this to alter the default check of the minor change box?   Eg a few characters or some minor formatting changes would trigger a minor change default.  If this would coupled with [CONF-3707] "Recently updated list on the dashboard should not show minor edits" things would be really nice.  A couple of global and/or space flags to control minor change display ("show all changes") and even a metric on what constitutes a minor change would ice the cake.
fields.summary: Detect Minor Edits

fields.description: On the Configure LDAP User Directory screen, using Microsoft Active Directory, in the LDAP Permission section, there's a box labeled "Default Group Memberships". The description for it reads "A comma-separated list of groups that users will be added to when they first log in. These groups will be created if they don't already exist". I can enter multiple group names with commas and save OK. But then when I Edit the settings again, the groups are displayed in the edit box using vertical pipes (|) instead of commas. When I click "Test Settings" I get this message "Group names cannot contain '|' characters" and I have to change the pipes to commans.
fields.summary: When editing Configure LDAP User Directory screen, existing Default Group Memberships are displayed with pipe instead of comma

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23111].
  {panel}

h3.Issue:

Users are prompted to download Google Gears while dragging and dropping in IE9 (Proof of poor HTML5 support on IE9), problem is, Google Gears does not support IE9 (No future plans to support IE9), hence, users are unable to use the feature. 

h3.Workaround:

Downgrading to IE8, and installing Google Gears (Google Gears supports up to IE8) enables the drag drop function again.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop attachments using IE9

fields.description:
When synchronising memberships with LDAP, and a user that Confluence hasn't yet synced has logged in while the sync is in progress, Confluence can get duplicate user or membership exceptions. In rare cases, the membership can have a hibernate ID attached to it, even though the object is not yet in the database. In this case, Confluence will get a null pointer exception after attempting to look up that membership and abort the synchronisation.

fields.description:
#Create a space named Test, with userA.
#Created a page with userB
#Moved the Page with userC

Email notification was sent successfully this way:

{code}

userB (Confluence)
	
show details 5:02 PM (43 minutes ago)
	
Move this Page
Page moved by userC

From: 	TEST > Home
To: 	Demonstration Space > Home

{code}

The email sender should be  the user who moved the page instead of the creator of the page.

PS.: the FROM field shows the correct user name when the page was edited. Only when it's moved that it's showing the wrong username.
fields.summary: Sender of the email for 'page moved' is the creator instead of the user who moved the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23100].
  {panel}

Since we started adding new not-null or multi-column constraints to existing data, we've been unable to cleanly upgrade customer data if it is imported via a XML backup restore. We need to fix this so we don't have to tell customers that their XML backups are no good for upgrades.

Affected tables include:
 * cwd_memberships (new in 3.5, new constraints in 3.5.6)
 * CONTENT_PERM and CONTENT_PERM_SET (new constraints in 3.5.2, 3.5.12)
 * BANDANA (new constraints in 3.5.9)
fields.summary: Repair constraint violations while restoring from backup
TOC Makro interprets Feed's content and extends TOC

fields.description:
This is a request to make space admins able to see the content of restricted pages in their own spaces.

Currently only confluence-administrators can do that.
fields.summary: make space admin able to see restricted pages in his own space

fields.description:
When files are embedded using the "viewdoc" macro, clicking the "Edit Document" link fails silently. (Office application fails to load. There is no indication of what is going on.)

I think it's a Firefox thing as the same file opens fine using IE7.

Please add support for Firefox 6 in the Firefox Add-On for the Office Connector.

Relevant documentation:

* Firefox add-on at Mozilla : https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/webdav-launcher/
* Firefox Add-On for the Office Connector: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector
fields.summary: Add support for Firefox 6 in the Firefox Add-On for the Office Connector

fields.description: We don't have very many tests around page and space permissions for users and groups that have been removed from LDAP. We should add some, if only to be sure that our code is working correctly.
fields.summary: Improve testing of removed user and group permissions

fields.description: If any of the notification related SOAP API methods are called with a page id that doesn't exist, they will throw a NullPointerException rather than the PageNotFoundException they are supposed to. This exception then triggers an attempt to render the 500 page, but that fails because SOAP methods will already commit their output before the 500 page begins rendering, which then throws an IllegalStateException.
fields.summary: SOAP notification service throws NPE, IllegalStateException when querying for non-existent pages

fields.description:
When I edit content, editor always mess up links inside it.
For example:
When I add in content Web links:
www.example1.com
... some content ...
www.example2.com

Result is, that my content is converted into (after save):
www.example1.comwww.example2.com
... some content ...
www.example2.com


What is strange, that this issue is completely random ... it mess up only some links, but I am adding them same way wia button in wysiwyg toolbar.
fields.summary: Wysiwyg editor messup links in content
Make versionComment field to be searchable as Confluence Search Field

fields.description: When the documentation theme is applied to a space, it will display the navigation bar when displaying each page only when the space key is specified in all caps in the URL. For example, this URL will display the page with the navigation bar: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Confluence+Documentation+Home, whereas this link will display the same page without the navigation bar: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/conf35/Confluence+Documentation+Home.
fields.summary: Documentation theme displays navigation bar only when space key is specified in all caps in the URL

fields.description:
When displaying the attached excel file, the embedded links (which we're added through "Edit Document") do not work, and they do not display properly.

The links end up something like "../../../../../../../../../../../display/SPACE/Page" and display as "display/SPACE/Page"

We can workaround the link by making it a fully qualified link to the URL("http://myWiki:8080/display/SPACE/page"). But we at least need it to display properly.

If this is already fixed in a newer version, just let me know, I know we are somewhat out of date.
fields.summary: Links in Embedded Excel files do not link and display correctly

fields.description:
Sometimes after editing, I click on the "Save" button and I get the error:

===================================
Proxy Error
The proxy server received an invalid response from an upstream server. The proxy server could not handle the request POST /wiki/pages/doeditpage.action.
Reason: Error reading from remote server


Apache/2.2.3 (CentOS) Server at wiki.proofpoint.com Port 80
===================================


I'm a newbie on this, so I can't tell you what's going on exactly.  However, I do have this suggestion:
please kick off an AUTO SAVE before doing the save requested by the user.  In that way, if the save fails, the auto save will prevent loss of data.  The Auto Save feature has helped me recover some of my lost work at times, but often not all of it.

I know we're running an older version (3.2), so I don't know if this have been fixed yet.
fields.summary: Save can fail and cause loss of work

fields.description:
h5. Summary of the issue
When creating a new user for 'Delegated LDAP Authentication', password field is available and compulsory to be filled in instead of removed/disabled. When managing the 'Delegated LDAP Authentication' user, the 'Reset Password' link is available. We should remove/disable this function for 'Delegated LDAP Authentication' to avoid any confusion.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create 'Delegated LDAP Authentication' User Directory and position it at the most top directory
# Add new user, password field available and compulsory to be filled:
!createnewuser.png!
# Reset password option is avaialble:
!setpassword.png!
# If you reset the password, you'll get System Error with the following stack trace:
{noformat}
2011-08-18 13:11:45,038 ERROR [http-8359-5] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- referer: http://localhost:8359/admin/users/setuserpassword.action?username=delegatedldapuser1 | url: /admin/users/dosetuserpassword.action | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.SetUserPasswordAction.doSet(SetUserPasswordAction.java:46)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

fields.description:
The section renders below the profile side bar when using Internet Explorer. When viewing the same page in FireFox the page renders properly.

The problem occurs on pages that have {section} and {column} macros. Each column has a minimum width that is determined from the content inside the column. When the Internet Explorer window is narrower than the minimum width, the columns drop below the "profile" pop-out. You can create this effect if the pop-out makes the columns too narrow, or just by resizing the Internet Explorer 8 window to make it narrower than the minimum width.

FireFox 5.0 does the right thing and just adds a scrollbar when the window gets too narrow for the content.
fields.summary: Confluence Render Issue with Internet Explorer 8
Errors during Wiki Content Migration need to specify location of problematic data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23078].
  {panel}

When a users creates a new space then default space permissions will be set.

We allow all of our users to create new spaces. Most of them have never seen the SpaceAdmin->Permissions page.
And Most of them do not read the "You can customize these permissions once the space is created." in the creation page.

The "Home" page of the new space could include a short description for the space admin like "Welcome to your new space. You can change permissions and other settings in the Space Admin area. See \[Link to Confluence Documentation\] for more details". The creator could remove this message by editing the page. He would be forced to read that.
fields.summary: Space Creation: Tell how to configure permissions

fields.description:
My users who have IE8 are unable to use the gallery feature. When they click on a gallery thumbnail, they get the the darkened background, but the image itself never pops up. I noticed that there was a 'errors on this page' icon in IE, and upon investigation got the error 'Not implemented - confluence.macros.advanced:fancy-box.js.'

I have attached a screenshot of the error dialog.
fields.summary: Galleries not working with IE 8

fields.description:
Using \ to ignore \\ (line space) does not work, cannot display windows network path in mark-up (for example \\servername\sub-folder\ )

Placing a \ before a \\ simply shows as \\\

but just putting \\ created a line space.

fields.description:
`{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23073].
  {panel}

Confluence does not currently support connecting to load-balanced AD servers.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+Management+Limitations+and+Recommendations
About half-way down:

"#3. Synchronising with AD servers behind a load balancer is not supported. As with synchronising between two different AD servers, Microsoft Active Directory does not replicate the uSNChanged attribute across instances. For that reason, we do not support connecting to different AD servers even when they are load balanced. You will need to select one server (preferably one that is local) to synchronise with instead of using the load balancer."

Many companies have a single DNS entry (mydomain.mycompany.com) that points to a load balancer that directs traffic to one of many directory servers.  (Or, some companies might use DNS round robin.)  However, neither the use of DNS round robin nor use of an actual load balancer is supported by Confluence -- both approaches to load balancing direct traffic to different servers, which would violate limitation #3 above.
Currently, Confluence only supports connecting to a single directory server, not different (load-balanced) servers.
fields.summary: Support load-balanced LDAP/AD servers with Confluence

fields.description:
Internal page links (with custom link aliases) on a page moved to a new space, get the space key of the originating space prefixed to their actual alias text.

*What does that mean?*

If you have a page containing an internal anchor link (based on the format {{\[see below|#sectionbelow]}}), which exists in a space called 'ORIGINAL' and you then move that page to another space called 'NEWSPACE', the anchor link changes to {{\[ORIGINAL:see below|#sectionbelow]}} after the page move.

In other words, the original space's space key gets prefixed to the alias text, when there should be no space key being prefixed at all, so for example, you'll get the following text being rendered after moving a page:
{quote}
... For more information, *ORIGINAL:see below*.
{quote}

This looks horrible when several such links have been used on a page that gets moved to another space.
fields.summary: Internal page links (with custom link aliases) on a page moved to a new space, get the space key of the originating space prefixed to their actual alias text.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23061].
  {panel}

Uploading a large plugin or large attachment causes an error using HSQL v2 or data truncation using an older version of HSQL.  The maximum size that can be stored using the current configuration is 16 MB.  

The current Hibernate->HSQL dialect maps blobs to longvarbinary types. These have a max size of 16MB. I think we can either change the dialect or configure HSQL to map longvarbinary types to blobs.

From the HSQLDB docs:
"You can set LONGVARBINARY to map to BLOB, with the sql.longvar_is_lob connection property or the SET DATABASE SQL LONGVAR IS LOB TRUE statement." 

Not sure which is easier to do.
fields.summary: Can't install a plugin or upload an attachment > 16MB using HSQL for evaluation

*Steps to replicate* 

1. Explore the file \confluence\WEB-INF\lib\confluence-3.x.jar
2. Open up the file {{com.atlassian/confluence/core/ ConfluenceActionSupport.properties}}
3. Edit the property default.page.title from Home to something else e.g Startseite
4. Save the file in {{<Confluence-Install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\core}}
5. Upon restart, it is expected that the default page title to be changed appropriately from *Home* but that was not the case.
6  If you  change any other property such as *action.space.add*, it works without any problem as shown in the screen capture.

This has caused incomplete translations on plugins. I have the exploded the German translation pack as an example and found out that the home property has been translated but fails to work due to this bug. Here is a section of the file:

{noformat}
################################################################
# ACTION:   CreateSpaceAction
################################################################

#formerly CreateSpaceAction.properties
title.add.space=Bereich erstellen
com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.actions.CreateSpaceAction.action.name=Bereich erstellen

space.key.exists=Der eingegebene Bereichsschl\u00fcssel existiert bereits.

default.page.title=Startseite
default.page.content=Dies ist die Startseite des Bereichs {0}.

title.add.space.success=Bereich erfolgreich erstellt
create.space.successful.message=Sie haben einen Bereich erstellt. Von hier aus k\u00f6nnen Sie...
{noformat}

fields.description:
Both IE7 and Firefox 3.5 use Google Gears to enable drag-and-drop functionality. To attach a file to a page in Confluence you can go to the Attachments page, drag a file from outside the browser, and drop it on the "drop zone". This will upload the file while showing a progress bar and then refresh the attachments page. This works in both IE7 & FF3.5. Hoever, in FF3.5 you can also use the edit page textarea, either RTE or wiki markup, as a drop zone. This does not work in IE7.

{panel}
*Steps to Repro:*
# edit a page in Confluence
# drag a file from outside the browser and drop it while hovering over the textarea

*Expected:*
The upload attachment modal window will appear displaying a progress bar, the file will be uploaded, and when finished, the page will refresh. 

*Actual:*
The file will be opened by IE. If the file type can be interpreted by the browser, such as an image, the image will load in the tab where you were previously viewing the edit page.
{panel}
The functionality in IE7 should match the functionality available in FF3.5.
fields.summary: in IE7 the edit textarea does not work as a drag-and-drop drop zone

h3. Cause
In Confluence 3.4.x or earlier, we don't check NULL value of CPS_ID under CONTENT_PERM table. We do that in 3.5.x or higher.

h3. Patch
Attached is a patch to address this issue that is known to work for Confluence 3.5.9 or later. It may work with 3.5.0-3.5.8, but that has not been tested.
h4. Contents
The patch contains 26 files in the following directories:
 * confluence/WEB-INF/classes/
   ** upgradeSubsystemContext.xml
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/core/DefaultContentPermissionManager.class
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/core/persistence/hibernate/ConfluenceHibernateConfig.class
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/importexport/xmlimport/DefaultObjectPersisterFactory.class
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/importexport/xmlimport/persister/
      *** HibernateMembershipPersister.class
      *** PersisterOperations.class
      *** 3x ReflectiveObjectPersister classes
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/security/
      *** ContentPermission.hbm.xml
      *** ContentPermissionSet.hbm.xml
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/ddl/
      *** AlterTableExecutor.class
      *** DdlExecutor.class
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/upgradetask/
      *** AddBandanaConstrantsUpgradeTask.class
      *** 4x BandanaKeyUniqueConstraintCleaner classes
      *** 7x ContentPermissionConstraintsCleaner classes
      *** ContentPermissionConstraintsUpgradeTask.class

h4. Installation
Before installing, ensure that your backup xml zip is current. This install will remove all existing data from the database, and only use whatever you load via the backup.

To install, you can:
 # Stop Confluence
 # Extract the patch into your <confluence install dir>. This will create various directories under <confluence install dir>/confuence/WEB-INF/classes.
 # Delete your old <confluence home dir>.
 # Start Confluence, and during setup, select "Restore From Backup", and restore the backup zip you which to install.

Alternatively, you can:
 # Stop Confluence
 # Extract the patch into your <confluence install dir>. This will create various directories under <confluence install dir>/confuence/WEB-INF/classes.
 # Start Confluence
 # Browse to "Confluence Admin > Backup & Restore", and restore the backup zip you which to install.

fields.description:
The reason for this bug is that OAuth 1.3.0 changed the look of the Tokens page to look more like: [Tokens Page|https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/attachments/1883570898/Eugene+Mak+Homeb.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1309389024976]

Instead of specifying the date when the token expires, the text has been changed to say that token "expires in %x days"

You can view this by going to: {{/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens}}

Confluence however has its own version of the tokens page at {{/users/revokeoauthtokens.action}}

There are a number of options for fixing this:
# Change the look of the page to match what the OAuth plugin provides
# Confluence introduces the i18n key in its own resource
# Change Confluence to simply use the OAuth plugin's page (this is the most desirable but is the most work, and therefore unlikely to be scheduled for Confluence 4.0)

fields.description: Exceptions thrown from worker threads in an executor service are swallowed without any logging. If we lose connectivity to the database for any reason during a reindex, this will not show up in the logs. We need to log if this ever happens, and if possible, attempt to reconnect and resume reindexing.
fields.summary: Improve error handling when rebuilding index

fields.description: Currently, if confluence is used with Active Directory and the username is not sAMAccountName, the automated upgrade will fail to detect that the LDAP server is AD, and could then trigger exceptions due to using the wrong page size when retrieving records, which then causes the upgrade to fail. To work around this, administrators are forced to jump through several hoops to get a working upgraded system (at its simplest: upgrade without atlassian-user.xml, drop atlassian-user.xml into position, log in as admin, manually add Active Directory in User Directories UI, run migratelocalgroups.jsp). We need to simplify this process so that administrators never have to recreate their AD configuration in Confluence or need to run manual upgrade steps.
fields.summary: Simplify upgrades with Active Directory and a custom username attribute

In the attached images you can see the space details before and after upgrading and the spacelist-macro where this error appears.
fields.summary: Migrating to Confluence 4.0 causes broken umlauts / special characters in space descriptions

fields.description:
h3. Problem: Manage Groups > groupname > Group Members not consistent with Manage Users > username > View User page

We use crowd to hold our Confluence user accounts, with the Internal Confluence directory as a failover.

We have a user that was once a member of the {{confluence-administrators}} group. Since then, he has been removed via the {{Manage Groups > confluence-administrators > Group Members}} page. Even though this user no longer has admin privileges when they log in, their account still displays on the {{Manage Groups > confluence-administrators > Group Members}} page. This makes it impossible to determine via the Confluence interface the actual/true list of members of a group.

With the help of your support staff, we have found that the inconsistency between group membership and a user's membership of a group is caused by the user still existing in the {{confluence-administrators}} group of the *Internal* directory. This is obviously a security concern; in the event that the server fails over to the Internal directory, unprivileged users will have administrative access to the server.

h3. Solution

* To resolve this, a "Directory" column could be added to the {{Manage Groups > groupname > Group Members}} page, so that it is clear in which directory the user account exists in that group.
* This may well cause users to be listed more than once, for each directory where they exist. To make this clearer for administrators, a filter could be added enabling them to choose between directories. For our server, the filter would allow "All Directories", "Crowd" and "Internal" to be selected.

h3. Temporary Workaround

If you encounter the above issue, where a user exists in a group and seemingly cannot be removed via the Confluence interface, go to {{User Directories}}, make the other directory the primary authenticator (in our case, the Internal directory), and then return to the {{Manage Groups > groupname > Group Members}} page and attempt to remove the user again. This must be done for every directory where the user exists before it will be removed from the {{Manage Groups > groupname > Group Members}} page. Finally, make the original directory the primary authenticator (in our case, Crowd)
fields.summary: Add "Directory" column and filter to Manage Groups > Group Members page, to resolve inconsistency between group membership and user membership of groups (incl proposed solution and workaround)
